title: Oppo Find N5 emerges in official-looking renders
description: Oppo has been on a teaser rampage for its upcoming Find N5 foldable. The device is expected to launch in China by February 20 and it will eventually make its way to global markets as the OnePlus Open 2. We now have our best look at the phone from a series of official-looking images shared by Evan Blass (@evleaks). Find N5 will be the thinnest foldable once it launches, with a rumored thickness of just 4.2mm in its unfolded state. For reference, the current slimmest commercially available foldable - Honor's Magic V3 is 4.35mm thick. We can see the device will be available in purple...
excerpt: Oppo's ultra-thin foldable is due to launch in China later this month. Oppo has been on a teaser rampage for its upcoming Find N5 foldable. The device is...
text: Oppo has been on a teaser rampage for its upcoming Find N5 foldable. The device is expected to launch in China by February 20 and it will eventually make its way to global markets as the OnePlus Open 2. We now have our best look at the phone from a series of official-looking images shared by Evan Blass (@evleaks). Find N5 will be the thinnest foldable once it launches, with a rumored thickness of just 4.2mm in its unfolded state. For reference, the current slimmest commercially available foldable - Honor's Magic V3 is 4.35mm thick. We can see the device will be available in purple (vegan leather), white and black. The camera island will feature a familiar look with a OnePlus 13-like triple camera setup with Hasselblad branding. Oppo Find N5 in its folded state Oppo Find N5/OnePlus Open 2 is rumored to bring an 8-inch LTPO OLED main display (2K resolution + 120Hz) with minimal screen crease. The main panel will be complemented by a 6.4-inch cover display. The foldable may opt for the seven-core Snapdragon 8 Elite chip alongside up to 16GB RAM and 1TB storage. For the cameras, we should see a trio of wide, telephoto, and ultrawide 50MP shooters. Oppo Find N5 unfolded We’re also expecting IPX6, IPX8, and IPX9 water resistance ratings and a 5,600 mAh battery with 80W wired charging. Source (private X profile)
html:
Oppo has been on a teaser rampage for its upcoming Find N5 foldable. The device is expected to launch in China by February 20 and it will eventually make its way to global markets as the OnePlus Open 2. We now have our best look at the phone from a series of official-looking images shared by Evan Blass (@evleaks).

Find N5 will be the thinnest foldable once it launches, with a rumored thickness of just 4.2mm in its unfolded state. For reference, the current slimmest commercially available foldable - Honor's Magic V3 is 4.35mm thick.

We can see the device will be available in purple (vegan leather), white and black. The camera island will feature a familiar look with a OnePlus 13-like triple camera setup with Hasselblad branding.


Oppo Find N5 in its folded state

Oppo Find N5/OnePlus Open 2 is rumored to bring an 8-inch LTPO OLED main display (2K resolution + 120Hz) with minimal screen crease. The main panel will be complemented by a 6.4-inch cover display.

The foldable may opt for the seven-core Snapdragon 8 Elite chip alongside up to 16GB RAM and 1TB storage. For the cameras, we should see a trio of wide, telephoto, and ultrawide 50MP shooters.


Oppo Find N5 unfolded

We’re also expecting IPX6, IPX8, and IPX9 water resistance ratings and a 5,600 mAh battery with 80W wired charging.

Source (private X profile)
